q: Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.
h:
“Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.” —
Robin Sharma

q: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
h:
“The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Would you rather live your life according to the approval of others or aligned with your truth and your dreams?
h:
“Would you rather live your life according to the approval of others or aligned with your truth and your dreams?” —
Robin Sharma

q: If I love myself I love you. If I love you I love myself.
h:
“If I love myself I love you. If I love you I love myself.” —
Rumi

q: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
h:
“Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Smell the cheese often so you know when it is getting old.
h:
“Smell the cheese often so you know when it is getting old.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: The more you know, the more you know you don't know.
h:
“The more you know, the more you know you don't know.” —
Aristotle

q: Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.
h:
“Truth is the offspring of silence and meditation.” —
Isaac Newton

q: The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.
h:
“The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
h:
“Why fit in when you were born to stand out?” —
Dr. Seuss

q: You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing.
h:
“You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing.” —
Alan Watts

q: You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.
h:
“You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.” —
Elon Musk

q: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
h:
“Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.” —
Og Mandino

q: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
h:
“Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.” —
John Wooden

q: Words used to attract the dull of wit are not to be relied on.
h:
“Words used to attract the dull of wit are not to be relied on.” —
Huang Po

q: When you lose your desire for things that do not matter, you will be free.
h:
“When you lose your desire for things that do not matter, you will be free.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
h:
“Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
h:
“Never spend your money before you have earned it.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
h:
“The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be.
h:
“When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Give so much away people insist on paying you.
h:
“Give so much away people insist on paying you.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.
h:
“Don't listen to the person who has the answers; listen to the person who has the questions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Everyday is a second chance.
h:
“Everyday is a second chance.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
h:
“Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.
h:
“Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.” —
James Allen

q: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
h:
“If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Persistence is very important. You should not give up unless you are forced to give up.
h:
“Persistence is very important. You should not give up unless you are forced to give up.” —
Elon Musk

q: Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.
h:
“Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.” —
Celestine Chua

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
h:
“With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
h:
“If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.” —
Meng Sonly

q: A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.
h:
“A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: The big thing is to make a winning effort. I'm not obsessed with wins.
h:
“The big thing is to make a winning effort. I'm not obsessed with wins.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.
h:
“When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.” —
Seungsahn

q: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
h:
“It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Someone who points out your flaws to you is not necessarily your enemy. Someone who speaks of your virtues is not necessarily your friend.
h:
“Someone who points out your flaws to you is not necessarily your enemy. Someone who speaks of your virtues is not necessarily your friend.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.
h:
“Living life in style also means living a life of balance.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
h:
“Opportunities multiply as they are seized.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.
h:
“Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.” —
Elon Musk

q: For every effect there is a root cause. Find and address the root cause rather than try to fix the effect, as there is no end to the latter.
h:
“For every effect there is a root cause. Find and address the root cause rather than try to fix the effect, as there is no end to the latter.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
h:
“Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Any fool can turn a blind eye but who knows what the ostrich sees in the sand.
h:
“Any fool can turn a blind eye but who knows what the ostrich sees in the sand.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Wherever you are, and whatever you do, be in love.
h:
“Wherever you are, and whatever you do, be in love.” —
Rumi

q: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
h:
“Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.” —
Alan Watts

q: Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.
h:
“Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Action is the foundational key to all success.
h:
“Action is the foundational key to all success.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.
h:
“Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.” —
Meng Sonly

q: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
h:
“The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
h:
“Talk is cheap. Show me the code.” —
Linus Torvalds

q: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
h:
“Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.” —
Harold Abelson

q: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
h:
“Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.” —
Martin Fowler

q: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
h:
“First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.” —
John Johnson

q: Learning to write programs stretches your mind and helps you think better.
h:
“Learning to write programs stretches your mind and helps you think better.” —
Bill Gates

q: The best way to learn to code is to code.
h:
“The best way to learn to code is to code.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
h:
“Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.” —
Chris Pine

q: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
h:
“Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.” —
Cory House

q: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
h:
“Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.” —
Austin Freeman

q: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
h:
“The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.” —
Dennis Ritchie

q: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
h:
“Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
h:
“If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.” —
Edsger W. Dijkstra

q: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
h:
“Code never lies, comments sometimes do.” —
Ron Jeffries

q: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession.
h:
“You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession.” —
John Romero

q: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
h:
“Make it work, make it right, make it fast.” —
Kent Beck

q: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
h:
“There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.” —
Beverly Sills

q: When you feel like quitting, think about why you started.
h:
“When you feel like quitting, think about why you started.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
h:
“Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Practice makes progress.
h:
“Practice makes progress.” —
Meng Sonly

q: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
h:
“The only way to do great work is to love what you do.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.
h:
“Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.” —
Robert Collier

q: Fall in love with the process, and the results will come.
h:
“Fall in love with the process, and the results will come.” —
Eric Thomas

q: Dream big. Start small. Act now.
h:
“Dream big. Start small. Act now.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.” —
Vincent Van Gogh

q: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
h:
“You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Strive for progress, not perfection.
h:
“Strive for progress, not perfection.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Stay curious. Keep learning. Keep coding.
h:
“Stay curious. Keep learning. Keep coding.” —
Meng Sonly

q: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
h:
“A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.” —
Doug Linder

q: Don't be afraid to start over. It's a chance to build something better.
h:
“Don't be afraid to start over. It's a chance to build something better.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
h:
“Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.” —
Filipe Fortes

q: Fail often so you can succeed sooner.
h:
“Fail often so you can succeed sooner.” —
Tom Kelley

q: Learning never exhausts the mind.
h:
“Learning never exhausts the mind.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
h:
“In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
h:
“Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.” —
Dan Salomon

q: Perseverance is the key to mastering code.
h:
“Perseverance is the key to mastering code.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Success in coding is a marathon, not a sprint.
h:
“Success in coding is a marathon, not a sprint.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Write code every day, and you'll improve every day.
h:
“Write code every day, and you'll improve every day.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Read code, write code, break code, fix code.
h:
“Read code, write code, break code, fix code.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Code is poetry, and you are the poet.
h:
“Code is poetry, and you are the poet.” —
Meng Sonly

q: If you can't explain your code simply, you don't understand it well enough.
h:
“If you can't explain your code simply, you don't understand it well enough.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Keep calm and keep coding.
h:
“Keep calm and keep coding.” —
Meng Sonly

q: The only constant in programming is change.
h:
“The only constant in programming is change.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
h:
“Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.” —
Patrick McKenzie

q: Coding is the language of the future. Learn it.
h:
“Coding is the language of the future. Learn it.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Stay committed. The journey is worth it.
h:
“Stay committed. The journey is worth it.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Every expert was once a beginner.
h:
“Every expert was once a beginner.” —
Helen Hayes

q: Effort is never wasted, even when it leads to failure.
h:
“Effort is never wasted, even when it leads to failure.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Success is built on the back of countless failed commits.
h:
“Success is built on the back of countless failed commits.” —
Meng Sonly

q: Learn from your bugs, they’re your best teachers.
h:
“Learn from your bugs, they’re your best teachers.” —
Meng Sonly
